Rule.Original: call from complaint number(X),contact staff(X) => [OAPNP]immediate complaint acknowledgment(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. complaintMadeInPerson(X): Customer makes complaint through in-person interaction. complaintMadeByTelephoneDirect(X): Customer makes complaint via telephone with direct staff contact. complaintMadeByEmail(X): Customer submits complaint through email. complaintMadeViaWebsite(X): Customer lodges complaint through Supplier's website or endorsed platform. complaintMadeByPost(X): Customer sends complaint via postal mail. complaintMadeByVoicemail(X): Customer leaves complaint via telephone voicemail without staff interaction. acknowledgeImmediately(X): Supplier provides acknowledgment of complaint during same interaction (in-person/phone). acknowledgeWithin2Days(X): Supplier sends complaint acknowledgment within 2 working days of receipt.

resolveComplaintFirstContact(X): Supplier seeks to resolve the complaint during the first interaction with the customer. complaintHandlingProcess(X): Supplier has a complaint handling process as per TCPC section 8. complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made to a Supplier in relation to its Telecommunications Products or the complaints handling process itself.

urgentComplaintProcess(X): Supplier has implemented a process for identifying and managing urgent complaints. complaintHandlingProcess(X): Supplier has a complaint handling process as per TCPC section 8. complaint(X): A complaint has been made by a customer. urgent(X): The complaint is urgent and requires expedited handling.
**Key Atoms Explained:** 1. **urgentComplaintProcess(X)** directly addresses the legal requirement to implement a dedicated process for urgent complaints. 2. **complaintHandlingProcess(X)** anchors the rule to the broader complaint handling framework (TCPC section 8). 3. **complaint(X)** and **urgent(X)** are split for flexibility in rules (e.g., *urgent(X) ∧ complaint(X) → activateUrgentProcess(X)*).

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (iv) requiring the appropriate Resolution of Complaints including: A. ensuring relevant staff are aware of the potential remedies available to Resolve a Complaint;
Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. staffAwareOfRemedies(X): Relevant staff are aware of potential remedies available to resolve a complaint. appropriateResolution(X): Supplier ensures complaints are resolved with appropriate remedies.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (iv) requiring the appropriate Resolution of Complaints including: B. tailoring any remedy offered to address the root cause of the Complaint and to address the individual circumstances of the Consumer or former Customer where these have been advised to the Supplier;

Rule.Original: complaint on topic(X),remedy for topic(X) => [OAPNP]offer remedy(X)
customer advise special circumstance(X),remedy for special circumstance(X) => [OAPNP]offer remedy special circumstance(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. rootCauseIdentified(X): The root cause of the complaint has been identified through Supplier's analysis. consumerCircumstancesAdvised(X): Consumer or former Customer has communicated their individual circumstances to the Supplier. tailoredRemedyProvided(X): Supplier offers a remedy specifically addressing both the complaint's root cause and the Consumer's advised circumstances.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (iv) requiring the appropriate Resolution of Complaints including: C. where the Complaints are indicative of a wider problem or issue, addressing the root cause of the problem or issue; and

Rule.Original: complaint on topic(X),complaint topic indicative of general problem(X),remedy for general problem(X) => [OAPP]implement remedy for general problem(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. complaintsIndicateWiderProblem(X): Complaints indicate a wider problem or systemic issue. addressRootCause(X): Supplier addresses the root cause of the problem identified through complaints.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (iv) requiring the appropriate Resolution of Complaints including: D. resolving Billing errors in current Bills;

Rule.Original: billing complaint(X),billing error(X) => [OAPNP]fix error current billing period(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: resolveBillingErrorInCurrentBill(X): Supplier resolves billing errors in current bills as part of complaint resolution. billingErrorInCurrentBill(X): Complaint involves a billing error in the current bill. complaintResolutionProcess(X): Supplier has a process for appropriate resolution of complaints as per TCPC requirements.

Rule.Original: complaint(X),-resolution(X),topic of complaint is on credit(X) => [OM]-credit management action(X)
-customer satisfaction(X),investigated(X),resolution(X),topic of complaint is on credit(X) => [OM]-credit management action(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier has received a complaint from a customer. disputedAmountSubjectOfComplaint(X): The disputed amount is the subject of complaint X. unresolvedComplaint(X): Complaint X remains unresolved. supplierAwareOfUnresolvedStatus(X): Supplier is aware complaint X has not been resolved to the consumer's satisfaction. complaintUnderInvestigationBySupplier(X): Complaint X is being investigated by the Supplier internally. complaintUnderInvestigationByTIO(X): Complaint X is being investigated by the Telecommunications Industry Ombudsman. complaintUnderInvestigationByThirdParty(X): Complaint X is being investigated by a relevant recognized third party. takeCreditManagementAction(X): Supplier initiates credit management activities related to complaint X.

Rules.Rule: complaint(X), disputedAmountSubjectOfComplaint(X), unresolvedComplaint(X), supplierAwareOfUnresolvedStatus(X), complaintUnderInvestigationBySupplier(X) => [F] takeCreditManagementAction(X)
complaint(X), disputedAmountSubjectOfComplaint(X), unresolvedComplaint(X), supplierAwareOfUnresolvedStatus(X), complaintUnderInvestigationByTIO(X) => [F] takeCreditManagementAction(X)

Rule.Original: complaint(X),notification sent less than 7 days(X),resolution(X) => [OM]-initiate legal proceedings(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): A Consumer or former Customer has made a Complaint to the Supplier. complaintHandledInternally(X): Supplier is handling the Complaint through its internal process. informedOfOutcome(X): Supplier has informed the Consumer or former Customer of the Complaint outcome. within7WorkingDaysAfterOutcome(X): The current date is within 7 Working Days after the Consumer was informed of the Complaint outcome. delayLegalProceedings(X): Supplier delays the commencement of legal proceedings related to the Complaint.

Rule.Original: complaint(X), complaint acknowledgment(X) => [OAPNP]inform proposed resolution 15 days(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: adviseResolutionWithin15Days(X): Supplier advises Customer of proposed Resolution of Complaint within 15 Working Days of receipt. complaintHandlingProcess(X): Supplier has a complaint handling process as per TCPC section 8.

urgentComplaint(X): Supplier identifies the Complaint as urgent. confirmProposedResolutionUrgent(X): Supplier confirms the proposed Resolution for the urgent aspects of the Complaint. consumerAcceptsUrgentResolution(X): Consumer accepts the proposed Resolution for the urgent aspects of the Complaint. implementUrgentResolutionWithin2Days(X): Supplier implements the urgent aspects of the Resolution within 2 Working Days after the Complaint is received.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (ix) where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for the urgent aspects of an Urgent Complaint) the Supplier must, advise the Consumer or former Customer before Working Day 15 (or Working Day 2 for Urgent Complaints), of: A. the reasons for the delay;
Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. urgentComplaint(X): Complaint is categorized as urgent due to critical impact on the customer. supplierAnticipatesDelay(X): Supplier determines the complaint resolution will exceed standard timelines. informReasonsBefore15Days(X): Supplier notifies customer of delay reasons before the 15-working-day deadline. informReasonsBefore2Days(X): Supplier notifies customer of delay reasons before the 2-working-day deadline for urgent cases.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (ix) where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for the urgent aspects of an Urgent Complaint) the Supplier must, advise the Consumer or former Customer before Working Day 15 (or Working Day 2 for Urgent Complaints), of: B. the specific timeframe for completion of the Resolution; and
Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a consumer. urgent(X): Complaint is categorized as urgent, requiring resolution within 2 working days. anticipatedResolutionExceedsTimeframe(X): Supplier determines the complaint resolution will exceed the standard 15 working days (or 2 days for urgent complaints). informConsumerBeforeDeadline(X): Supplier notifies consumer about resolution delay before original deadline expires. specifyNewResolutionTimeframe(X): Supplier provides consumer with a revised completion timeframe for the resolution.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (ix) where a Supplier does not believe the Complaint can be Resolved in 15 Working Days (or within 2 Working Days for the urgent aspects of an Urgent Complaint) the Supplier must, advise the Consumer or former Customer before Working Day 15 (or Working Day 2 for Urgent Complaints), of: C. if the anticipated delay is a further 10 Working Days or more and is not the result of a declared mass service disruption, advising the Consumer or former Customer of their options for external dispute resolution including the TIO;

Rule.Original: complaint(X),-declare mass disruption(X),-resolvable 25 days(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)
complaint(X),-declare mass disruption(X),-resolvable 2 days(X),urgent(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier receives a complaint from a customer. urgentComplaint(X): Complaint is categorized as urgent by the Supplier. cannotResolveWithin15Days(X): Supplier determines complaint resolution will exceed 15 working days. cannotResolveWithin2Days(X): Supplier determines urgent complaint resolution will exceed 2 working days. informDelayBeforeDeadline(X): Supplier notifies customer about resolution delay before 15-day/2-day deadline. delayExceeds10AdditionalDays(X): Anticipated resolution delay extends beyond initial deadline by ≥10 working days. massServiceDisruptionDeclared(X): Delay is caused by a formally declared mass service disruption. informExternalDisputeOptions(X): Supplier provides information about TIO and external dispute resolution mechanisms.

promisedTimeframe(X): Supplier has committed to a specific timeframe for handling a complaint or part of it. informDelay(X): Supplier informs Customer of any delays to the promised timeframe for handling a complaint.
provideComplaintProgressMeans(X): Supplier provides a means for the Customer to monitor the progress of a Complaint. complaint(X): A complaint has been made by the Customer.

complaint(X): There is a complaint from a consumer or former customer. investigationCompleted(X): Supplier has completed its investigation of the complaint. adviseResolutionEverydayLanguage(X): Supplier advises consumer/former customer of complaint resolution using clear, non-technical language.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (xiii) completing all necessary actions to deliver the Resolution offered within 10 Working Days of the Consumer’s or former Customer’s acceptance of that Resolution unless: A. otherwise agreed with the Consumer or former Customer; or B. the actions are contingent on actions by the Consumer or former Customer that have not been completed;

Rule.Original: agreed custom resolution date(X),complaint(X) => [OAPNP]resolve by custom date(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: customerAcceptedResolution(X): Customer or former Customer has accepted the Resolution offered by the Supplier. resolutionDeliveredWithin10Days(X): Supplier completes all necessary actions to deliver the Resolution within 10 Working Days of acceptance. agreedExtension(X): Supplier and Customer mutually agree to modify the 10-day Resolution delivery timeframe. resolutionContingentOnCustomerActions(X): Resolution implementation depends on actions/inputs required from the Customer. customerActionsIncomplete(X): Required Customer actions for Resolution implementation have not been completed.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (xiv) only Closing a Complaint with the consent of the Consumer or former Customer or if clauses 8.2.1(c),(d) or (e) below have been complied with; and

Rule.Original: complaint(X),escalation(X),frivolous or vexatious(X),inform reasons not to proceed(X),no further assistance(X) => [-OM]-close case(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: closeComplaint(X): Supplier closes the complaint. consumerConsentToCloseComplaint(X): Consumer or former Customer consents to the Supplier closing the Complaint. compliedWithClauses8_2_1cde(X): Supplier has complied with clauses 8.2.1(c), (d), or (e) of the TCPC. complaint(X): There is an active Complaint from a Consumer or former Customer that requires resolution.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (a) Demonstrate fairness, courtesy, objectivity and efficiency: Suppliers must demonstrate, fairness and courtesy, objectivity, and efficiency by: (xv) where a Complaint is Closed with the consent of the Consumer or former Customer, at the Consumer’s or former Customer’s requests, providing a written confirmation of the Resolution of that Complaint to be sent the Consumer or former Customer within 5 Working Days.

Rule.Original: close case(X),complaint(X),customer consent close case(X),customer request confirmation of resolution(X) => [OAPNP]provide confirmation resolution 5 days(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaintClosedWithConsent(X): Complaint is closed with the consumer's consent. consumerRequestsWrittenConfirmation(X): Consumer requests written confirmation of the resolution. provideWrittenConfirmationWithin5Days(X): Supplier provides written confirmation of the resolution within 5 working days.

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (b) Respond to dissatisfaction with timeframes: If a Consumer tells the Supplier that they are dissatisfied with the timeframes that apply to the management of a Complaint or seek to have a Complaint treated as an Urgent Complaint, the Supplier must tell the Consumer about the Supplier's internal prioritisation and internal escalation processes. If, after internal prioritisation and internal escalation the Consumer remains dissatisfied, the Supplier must tell the Consumer of the options for external dispute resolution, including the TIO.

Rule.Original: customer dissatisfied timeframe(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)
customer dissatisfied timeframe(X),escalation(X),internal prioritisation(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions: complaint(X): Supplier has received a complaint from a consumer. consumerDissatisfiedTimeframes(X): Consumer expresses dissatisfaction with timeframes applied to complaint management. consumerRequestsUrgent(X): Consumer requests their complaint be treated as an Urgent Complaint. informInternalPrioritization(X): Supplier informs Consumer about internal complaint prioritization processes. informInternalEscalation(X): Supplier informs Consumer about internal complaint escalation processes. consumerRemainsDissatisfied(X): Consumer continues to express dissatisfaction after internal prioritization/escalation. informExternalDisputeResolution(X): Supplier informs Consumer about external dispute resolution options (including TIO).

Paragraph.RelevantText: 8.2.1 A Supplier must take the following actions to enable this outcome: (c) Respond to dissatisfaction with progress or outcome: If a Consumer or former Customer tells the Supplier that they are dissatisfied with the progress or Resolution of a Complaint or asks about their options to pursue a Complaint further, the Supplier must tell them about: (i) the Supplier's internal escalation process; and (ii) the options for external dispute resolution including the TIO.

Rule.Original: customer dissatisfied progress(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)
customer dissatisfied progress(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)
customer dissatisfied resolution(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)
customer dissatisfied resolution(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)
customer asks pursue complaint further(X) => [OAPNP]inform internal escalation process(X)
customer asks pursue complaint further(X) => [OAPNP]inform external dispute resolution(X)
customer consent close case(X),customer dissatisfied progress(X),inform external dispute resolution(X),inform internal escalation process(X) => complied821c(X)
customer consent close case(X),customer dissatisfied resolution(X),inform external dispute resolution(X),inform internal escalation process(X) => complied821c(X)

Paragraph.GeneratedElementDescriptions:
complaint(X): Supplier has received a complaint from a customer. expressDissatisfaction(X): Customer expresses dissatisfaction with the progress or resolution of their complaint. askFurtherOptions(X): Customer asks about options to escalate or continue pursuing their complaint. informInternalEscalation(X): Supplier informs customer about their internal complaint escalation process. informExternalDisputeOptions(X): Supplier informs customer about external dispute resolution mechanisms including the TIO.
**Key details:** 1. Two trigger atoms (expressDissatisfaction/askFurtherOptions) capture customer actions that activate the requirement 2. Separate consequence atoms for each mandated disclosure (internal process and external options) 3. Base complaint(X) atom establishes the prerequisite context of an existing complaint 4. Atoms avoid negations and follow "simple breakdown" principle (e.g., separating escalation info from external options info)
